function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Participants were not willing to pay for certain HEMS features, potentially impacting the adoption and implementation of these features.","Impact":"Reduced usage of HEMS features, potential lack of funding for development and support.","Mitigation":"Market research and targeted marketing to increase awareness of the value of HEMS features.","Technologies":"Data analysis, targeted advertising, user feedback collection.","People":"Participants, developers, manufacturers, and stakeholders in HEMS technology.","Owner":"Marketing teams, research teams, and HEMS technology developers."},{"Description":"HEMS features that contribute to reducing community environmental impacts during the COVID-19 pandemic were particularly unpopular, indicating a potential lack of interest in sustainability-focused features.","Impact":"Reduced adoption of sustainability-focused HEMS features, less impact on reducing environmental impacts.","Mitigation":"Educational campaigns on the benefits of sustainability, highlighting cost savings and environmental impact.","Technologies":"Data visualization tools, social media platforms, educational content.","People":"Participants, environmental advocates, and stakeholders in sustainability technology.","Owner":"Educational organizations, environmental advocacy groups, and HEMS technology developers."},{"Description":"Variability in willingness to pay for different HEMS features may lead to unequal access to beneficial features based on cost, potentially exacerbating socioeconomic disparities.","Impact":"Unequal access to valuable HEMS features, perpetuation of inequality in resource access.","Mitigation":"Subsidies or financial assistance programs for low-income households, pricing options for different feature bundles, and inclusive design considerations.","Technologies":"Online payment systems, financial modeling tools, user interface design.","People":"Low-income households, policymakers, and stakeholders in equality and inclusion.","Owner":"Government agencies, financial institutions, and HEMS technology developers."}]}
